Description: Identifies a stop, station, or station entrance.

Short text or a number that identifies the location for riders. These codes are often used in phone-based transit information systems or printed on signage to make it easier for riders to get information for a particular location. The stop_code can be the same as stop_id if it is public facing. This field should be left empty for locations without a code presented to riders.
Name of the location. Use a name that people will understand in the local and tourist vernacular.
Description of the location that provides useful, quality information.

Domain: 0 - Stop or Platform; 1 - Station; 2 - Entrance/Exit; 3 - Generic Node; 4 - Boarding Area

Description: Flag field for stops served by 1 or more transit routes with headways of 30 minutes or less during BOTH the AM (6:00 - 10:00 AM) and PM (3:00 - 7:00 PM) peak commute periods.
Flag field for stops served by 1 or more transit routes with headways of 15 minutes or less during BOTH the AM (6:00 - 10:00 AM) and PM (3:00 - 7:00 PM) peak commute periods.

To qualify as a 'Major Transit Stop', as defined by As defined by California Public Resource Code Section 21064.3, a stop must be a rail or ferry stop, or the stop must be served by 2 or more transit routes with headways of 15 minutes or less during BOTH the AM (6:00 - 10:00 AM) and PM (3:00 - 7:00 PM) peak commute periods.

To fall into a given headway class, stops had to meet the headway threshold for both AM (6:00 - 10:00 AM) and PM (3:00 - 7:00 PM) Peak Periods. Not available is used for stops served by routes where headway information may be unavailable for both am and pm commute periods, or the stop is the location of a transit station.
Domain: 15 min or less; 16 to 30 min; 31 min or more; Not Available

Description: Indicates the agency or operator of a transit system.
Name of the agency or operator of a transit system.
Indicates the type of transportation used on a route. Route type may be null if location is a transit station or transit center.
Domain: 0 - Tram, Streetcar, Light rail; 1 - Subway, Metro; 2 - Rail; 3 - Bus; 4 - Ferry; 5 - Cable tram; 6 - Aerial lift; 7 - Funicular; 11 - Trolleybus; 12 - Monorail;

Description: Text type of transportation used on a route. Route type may be null if location is a transit station or transit center.
